fields.name: Level 1 Systematic Corrections
fields.description: Radiometric corrections of the differences in sensitivy of the detectors based on in-flight calibrations (Level 1A).  Geometric corrections take into account both internal and external orientations of the satellite in relation to the earth to account for scan line misallignment and non-uniform pixel sizes (Level 1B).  Level 1 imagery is often referred to by customers as "raw" imagery as there is still a great deal of processing required before spatial or spectral analysis can be performed.

fields.name: Level 1A Radiometric
fields.description: Radiometric corrections of the differences in sensitivy of the detectors based on in-flight calibrations.

fields.name: Level 1B Geometric
fields.description: Geometric corrections take into account both internal and external orientations of the satellite in relation to the earth to account for scan line misallignment and non-uniform pixel sizes.

fields.name: Level 2 Georeferenced
fields.description: Georeferenced into a standard map projection.  Level 2A is geolocated to the satellite predicted position at the time of the acquisition and still has location errors (not recommended for spatial analysis).  Level 2B is geolocated against a georeferenced reference image and rectified using ground control points (GCPs) in both images with a positional accuracy of the spatial resolution of the original image excluding mountainous areas.

fields.name: Level 2A Projected
fields.description: Geolocated to the satellite predicted position at the time of the acquisition and still has location errors (not recommended for spatial analysis).

fields.name: Level 2B GCP Geolocated
fields.description: Geolocated to a georeferenced reference image and rectified using ground control points (GCPs) in both images with a positional accuracy of the spatial resolution of the original image excluding mountainous areas.

fields.name: Level 3 Orthorectified
fields.description: Orthorectification using GCP points, reference imagery and a digital elevation model (DEM) to accurately locate areas of high relief.  The positional accuracy is expected to be the same as the spatial resolution of the original image including mountainous areas.

fields.name: Level 3Aa Orthorectified
fields.description: Orthorectification using GCP points, reference imagery and 20m DEM.  Suitable for spatial analysis including digitising.

fields.name: Level L3Ab Reflectance at Sensor
fields.description: Reflectance values at top of atmosphere (at scanner reflectance).  Suitable for visual interpretaton, spectral signature analysis, classification and derivation of indices (NDVI, EVI).

fields.name: Level 3 True Colour
fields.description: Blue band creation for SPOT for natural colour visualisation
